sen.j: 藤原 宗家（ふじわら の むねいえ、保延5年（1139年） - 文治5年4月22日 (旧暦)（1189年6月7日））は、平安時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Muneie (1139 - June 7, 1189) was a Kugyo (a top court official) in the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Muneie (1139 - June 7, 1189) was a Kugyo (a top court official) during the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Muneie (1139 - May 16, 1189) was a Kugyo (a top court official) during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.j: 初名は信能（長寛2年（1164年）まで）。
sen.e: His original name was Nobuyosi (until 1164).
His original name was Nobuyosi (until 1164).
His original name was Nobuyoshi (until 1164).

sen.j: 藤原北家中御門流の内大臣藤原宗能の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of Inner Minister (Nai-Daijin) FUJIWARA no Muneyoshi, who belonged to Nakamikado Line of the House of Fujiwara North.
He was the first son of Inner Minister (Nai-Daijin) FUJIWARA no Muneyoshi, who belonged to the Nakamikado Line of the House of Fujiwara North.
He was the first son of Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior) FUJIWARA no Muneyoshi, who belonged to the Nakamikado Line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 永治元年（1141年）に従五位に叙され、久安5年（1149年）に従五位上侍従に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1141, he was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) and appointed to Jugoinojo jiju (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade Chamberlain) in 1149.
In 1141, he was appointed to Jugoi (Junior 5th Rank) and appointed to Jugoinojo jiju (Junior 5th Rank, Upper Grade Chamberlain) in 1149.
In 1141, he was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) and appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) jiju (Chamberlain) in 1149.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 久安7年（1151年）に正五位に進む。
sen.e: He was promoted to Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) in 1151.
He was promoted to Shogoi (Senior 5th Rank) in 1151.
He was promoted to Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) in 1151.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 久寿2年（1155年）に右近衛少将に任ぜられ、翌年に従四位下左近衛少将に任じられ、続いて従四位上に進む。
sen.e: He was appointed to Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards in 1155, to Jushii Sakon e no shosho (Junior Fourth Rank, lowest general of Sakon-e-fu) in the next year, and successively promoted to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).

He was appointed to Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards in 1155, to Jushii Sakon e no shosho (Junior 4th Rank, lowest general of Sakon-e-fu) in the next year, and successively promoted to Jushiinojo (Junior 4th Rank, Upper Grade).

He was appointed to Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1155, to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in the following year, and successively promoted to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 保元3年（1158年）に正四位下左近衛中将、翌年には蔵人頭を兼ねて頭中将となり、更に中宮権亮を兼ねる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Shoshii Sakon e no Chujo (Senior Fourth Rank, Middle Captain of Sakon-e-fu) in 1158 and became Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) in the next year, serving as an additional post of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and also served as Chugushiki (Office of the Consort's Household).

He was appointed to Shoshii Sakon e no Chujo (Senior 4th Rank, Middle Captain of Sakon-e-fu) in 1158 and became Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) in the next year, serving as an additional post of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and also served as Chugushiki (Office of the Consort's Household).

He was appointed to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1158 and became Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain) in the next year, serving as an additional post of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and also served as Chugu Gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Master of the Consort's Household).
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 永暦元年（1160年）に参議に任ぜられ、応保2年（1162年）に従三位に進む。
sen.e: In 1160, he was appointed to Sangi (councillor) and was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1162..
In 1160, he was appointed to Sangi (councillor) and was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior 3rd Rank) in 1162..
In 1160, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor) and was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1162.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 長寛2年（1164年）に正三位に進む。
sen.e: In 1164, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
In 1164, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior 3rd Rank).
In 1164, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)元年（1166年）に権中納言に任ぜられ、2年後に中納言に転じる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Chunagon (Middle Counselor) in 1166 and switched to Chunagon.
sen.cmt: 「(中納言から)中納言に転じる」は何らかの誤りと思われますが、そのまま訳しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to Chunagon (Middle Counselor) in 1166 and switched to Chunagon.
He was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1166 and switched to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) two years later.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 承安 (日本)2年（1172年）に従二位、安元2年（1176年）に正二位に進み、治承3年（1179年）に大納言に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was promoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1172 and promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in 1179, and was appointed to Dainagon (Major Counselor) in 1179.
He was promoted to Junii (Junior 2nd Rank) in 1172 and promoted to Shonii (Senior 2nd Rank) in 1179, and was appointed to Dainagon (Major Counselor) in 1179.
He was promoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1172 and promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in 1176, and was appointed to Dainagon (chief councilor of state) in 1179.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 文治5年（1189年）に腹病のために死去。
sen.e: He deceased of an illness in his stomach in 1189.
He died from an illness in his stomach in 1189.
He died from an illness in his stomach in 1189.

sen.j: 父より神楽・琴の秘伝を継ぎ、松木家（中御門家）を楽道の家として発展させる基礎を築いた。
sen.e: He succeeded secret teachings of Kagura (a musical dance) and koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) from his father and formed the basis for the Matsunoki family (the Nakanomikado family) to blossom as the family of Gakudo(school of Japanese Court Music).

He succeeded in the secret teachings of Kagura (a musical dance) and koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) from his father and formed the basis for the Matsunoki family (the Nakanomikado family) to blossom as the family of Gakudo (school of Japanese Court Music).

He succeeded in the secret teachings of Kagura (a musical dance) and koto (a long Japanese zither with 13 strings) from his father and formed the basis for the Matsunoki family (also known as the Nakamikado family) to blossom as the family of Gakudo (school of Japanese Court Music).
sen.cmt: 用語修正、補足しました。
